thread.title: Dirk Nowitzki hits a dagger 3-pointer, only to have C.J. McCollum top it with a game-winner
thread.title_full: Dirk Nowitzki hits a dagger 3-pointer, only to have C.J. McCollum top it with a game-winner

author: Mark Sandritter
title: Dirk Nowitzki hits a dagger 3-pointer, only to have C.J. McCollum top it with a game-winner
text: Rec The Mavericks and Blazers played an incredibly exciting, back-and-forth game on Tuesday, literally needing every second of the clock to trade clutch shots. Because it was the Mavericks and because Dirk Nowitzki is Dirk Nowitzki, he was heavily involved. First, Nowitzki gave the Mavericks a 108-107 lead with this three in transition. The celebration was even better. — Matt Ellentuck (@mellentuck) February 8, 2017 That shot came with just 38 seconds left, but Portland’s C.J. McCollum had an answer. McCollum made back-to-back buckets for Portland, the latter giving the Blazers 111-110 lead with 12 seconds left. But, Dirk wasn’t done. Seconds later, he did this. Dirk being Dirk pic.twitter.com/P3OdOcfg8w — CSN Northwest (@CSNNW) February 8, 2017 With just 3.9 seconds left, it was easy to think that might be the game-winner. Yet again, McCollum had other ideas. CJ Blazers win! pic.twitter.com/uXE4vHKm6C — CSN Northwest (@CSNNW) February 8, 2017 Five made shots, six points each in the final 40 seconds and one of the best finishes of the season. Next Up In ##Lookit
